title: (x) "Tidy" font from Moo.com - Hypatia {Stephen}
content:
Hi! I was wondering what font/typeface Moo.com is using for the "Tidy" option in their [Business Card Designer](http://web.archive.org/web/20110122162428/http:/www.moo.com/start.php?pid=149&tpl_0=businesscard_front_textomatic). I've ran it through WhatTheFont and gave Identifont a shot as well, but they didn't turn up with anything.

Here's an image:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110122162428im_/http:/typophile.com/files/typophile_4449.png)

Thanks a ton in advance!
author: EvanC

comments.content: It's [Thomas Phinney](http://web.archive.org/web/20110122162428/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Thomas%20Phinney)'s [Hypatia](http://web.archive.org/web/20110122162428/http:/www.adobe.com/type/browser/landing/hypatia/hypatia.html), published by Adobe but only available in Adobe CS apps for now.

So it is! Good eye Stephen.(I have the new CS Apps and confirmed your ID.)

- Mike Yanega

That's an absolute shame, it means I have no way of getting my hands on it.

Thanks a lot for the ident though!
Well there is a way, but it costs a few hundred dollars: buy Adobe CS3.
Er, does that mean that Moo.com is using an Adobe font on a web server and renaming it, violating its license in two dastardly ways?
I'm not sure about the renaming part, but I don't think they are necessarily violating the EULA.
